ygData.messageBody:
I wasn't suggesting it was a good idea to have items eventually fall apart.
Just pointing out that the fact items wear out in RL does have a serious
effect on the economy. Now, if they didn't have items completely wear out,
but maybe eventually go down to 75% of their max stats and stay there until
repaired by a skilled tradesman. They would have to make it so repairs
didn't result in the original item being destroyed, however. How'd you like
to take your tunic in for repairs and have the smith destroy it. Magic
items would be indestructible, of course. Bah, I hate the entire idea. I
wish they'd fix fletching instead.


"
I was reading an email from someone that compared the EQ market to the US
market. They stated that one reason they are different is because in RL
things wear out and in EQ they are eternal. This is so true. Has anyone
thought of or actually talked to Verant about having armor wear out? This
would cause buyers to go to smiths for repairs or replacements. I don't
know if this seems like a good idea or not. I think it does. Let me know
what you all think of this idea.
"
